discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
By assigning the shared drive to the finance organizational unit, any DLP policies applied to that OU will automatically apply to the shared drive. This ensures consistency in security settings and simplifies management.

Selected Answer: B
The phrasing askes to complete the task in the most efficient manner possible. Creating a new DLP rule is more time consuming than simply assigning the shared drive to the OU where the DLP rule already exists. Correct answer is B.
i think only assigning the drive is not enough

Selected Answer: B
My bad, it's B. If you want the data protection rules set for an organizational unit to apply to certain shared drives. Assign the shared drives to that organizational unit so that the same data protection rules apply.

Selected Answer: C
Since Shared Drives are not directly tied to OUs, you need to create and apply a separate DLP policy that targets the Shared Drives.

questions.question_text: You have implemented a data loss prevention (DLP) policy for a specific finance organizational unit. You want to apply the same security policy to a shared drive owned by the finance department in the most efficient manner. What should you do?

choices.B: Assign the Shared Drive to the finance organizational unit.
choices.C: Create a new DLP policy for shared drive users.
choices.D: Change the scope of the policy to apply to all in the domain.
choices.A: In the Admin console sharing settings, select the finance organizational unit and deselect Allow users outside the domain to access files in shared drives.
Enable 2-Step Verification for those users and recommend they use Google Authenticator.
choices.D: Enroll all accounts for those users in the Advanced Protection Program.
choices.B: Enable 2-Step Verification for those users and recommend they use SMS codes.
choices.C: Disable password recovery for end users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. The Advanced Protection Program is designed specifically to protect users who are at high risk of targeted attacks.

questions.question_text: Your organization has a group of users who interact with sensitive information and their accounts contain valuable files. You need to protect these users from targeted online attacks. What should you do?

choices.B: Suspend their account in the Admin console.
choices.D: Remove the user license in the Admin console.
choices.C: Delete the user after copying their emails and reassigning their documents to their manager.

questions.question_text: An employee at your company does not need access to their Workspace account while they are on leave for a year. When they return, you need to ensure they have access to their account and that all their data and current emails remain intact. Also, their shared documents must be available to other users. You must accomplish this goal in the most cost-effective way. What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

comments.content: documents from archived account ARE available to other users, so A is correct

discussion.content:
this is definitely B!!!!
the key : Also, their shared documents must be available to other users!!!!
archived user : data, documents is not available for others!!

Selected Answer: A
Agree with A

Selected Answer: A
I agree with Chetantest07, this ensures that their emails, documents, and other data remain intact and accessible to other users who need it. When the employee returns, you can reassign a full user license to restore their access to the account.

Correct Answer A. Assigning Archive licnese. 
 Suspended accounts are still charged at the same rate as active accounts on both the Annual billing plan and the Flexible plan. https://support.google.com/a/answer/33312?hl=en

Removing user license will not help in maintaining user data and providing access to others.

Selected Answer: B
I believe it's B.
To enforce the company policy of not sending file attachments externally, the most effective solution is to create an attachment compliance rule. This rule can be configured to automatically remove attachments from emails sent to external recipients. Additionally, it can notify the sender that their email violated the company policy, ensuring they are aware of the restriction.

questions.question_text: Employees at your company sent emails with physical file attachments to external recipients. However, it is against company policy to send file attachments externally. You need to enforce the policy and alert the sender. What should you do?

choices.C: Create an email denylist to block external mail recipients from receiving messages with physical files attached.
choices.A: Quarantine messages that contain attachments for all external recipients.
choices.B: Create an attachment compliance rule that removes attachments from external messages and notifies recipients.
choices.D: Store the files in a shared drive and add the recipients as members.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This will provide crucial information about the event's configuration, including attendee lists, notification settings, and any potential errors in the event data.

choices.D: Capture the laptop OS version of the user to troubleshoot if there are older versions of the event being displayed.
choices.C: Capture the relevant Event IDs and the ICS files by using the Show original option.
choices.A: Capture the Gmail labels used by the reported user.
choices.B: Capture the number of times the Event is set for recurrence to ensure that the host is not hitting the email limits.

questions.question_text: An employee at your organization created a recurring calendar event. When they made edits to the recurring event, none of the event attendees received email notifications with the changes. You collected the Google Calendar IDs and user emails. You must troubleshoot the issue and collect additional information from the event attendees before contacting the Google Support team. What should you do?
